intro: Physandra, commonly known as the foam flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is native to eastern North America and features heart-shaped leaves that often have a waxy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Physandra thrives in shady, moist environments and is often used in woodland gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and delicate blossoms.
